page.title: 02Farming
page.content: As yaxley is situated on the edge of the fens farming has always played a large part in the life of the village. The fens today have flat land,black soil and a great lack of trees apart from around the farms it's a very reconizable landscape.The whole area is criss-crossed by lines of the artificial drainage ditches which help to drain the water from the land.These channels also act as field boundries. Since the drainage the fens have become increasingly important as on arable farming area.A century ago it was a mixed livestock and cropping region but today only 10% of farm incomes in the fens are taken from live stock and livestock products.At the moment 80% of the area is under crops.The climate,soils and relief all help to mak this one of the most intensively farmed regions of the
